I'm using JUnit 4 from Eclipse, and my test class extends DBTestCase. Using
annotations and other JUnit 4 features, however, doesn't work from Eclipse,
which warns that no tests can be found on the class. However, it works when
I remove extends DBTestCase from my test class.

I found an example that uses a @BeforeClass annotation that manually calls
DBUnit's methods, but I see this as a (hopefully temporary) workaround that
you might have the right alternative to. How do I integrate DBUnit and JUnit
4 from within Eclipse the way it was meant to be used (i.e. no workarounds)?

Thanks.
--
